Ijegun Egba to Coconut Landing-16 Minutes
Coconut Landing to Liverpool-5 Minutes

Public.departure_trigger: They leave on a strict schedule at 7am - 7:30am
Public.rain: The rain doesn't affect the route except it's very heavy rain that can hinder navigation
Public.weekend: They do not make this trip on weekends
Public.notes: This Ferry operates just once a day in the morning. It arrives at 7:00am and leaves before 7:30am. The main official stops are liverpool, CMS and the destination - falomo

Public.rain: They suspend activities while it rains , only covered boats can leave

Public.rain: If it is drizzling, operations will continue. However, if it is raining heavily, operations will be halted
Public.other_disruptions: In the event of terrible weather, they may have to dock at the nearest terminal or jetty before continuing their journey
Public.weekend: No, they don't make this trip
Public.notes: You Can charter a Ferry to this destination on select saturdays and sundays, depending on the availability of the charter service. Charter prices range from 40000 naira to 50000 naira. Each morning, Liverpool (apapa) receives passengers from this destination, and in the evening, it sends passengers back to this location

Private.departure_trigger: They wait till they are full
Private.rain: If drizzling, the boats continue operations. However, if heavy, operations are halted
Private.other_disruptions: If a moving boat is caught in heavy rain, it may be forced to dock at the nearest jetty, or landing
Private.weekend: Same schedule on weekends
Private.notes: Depending on the banana boat, you may have to wait for 12 to 15 passengers to board before taking off. Market days are the greatest time to take this route. The market days are tuesdays, fridays, and saturdays, and wait times are almost nonexistent these days. Ideally, boat operators should not take trips after 6:00pm, but many do and close by 8: 00pm. If a covered boat is chartered, it makes the trip. The boat operators also operate on holidays

Private.departure_trigger: They leave when they are full
Private.rain: If it drizzles, the boat will continue to move. If it is pouring excessively and there is no movement, operations are suspended. If it's pouring heavily and the boat is moving, it may have to dock at the nearest landing or jetty
Private.other_disruptions: Heavy rains disrupt the route, forcing boats in motion to dock at the nearest landing or jetty
Private.weekend: Yes. Same schedule
Private.notes: The boat leaves at exactly 07:00 am in the morning and returns to Liverpool at around 06:00pm before leaving at 07:00 pm on market days (tuesdays, fridays, and saturdays). You can't board this boat on the days Other than the market days. A banana boat Can accommodate up from twelve to fifteen passengers for this trip

Public.duration_between_stops:
Liverpool (Apapa) to CMS/Marina-10 Minutes
CMS/Marina to Five Cowries Terminal-10 Minutes
Public.departure_trigger: They leave on a strict schedule
Public.rain: If it drizzles, the boat will continue to move. If it is pouring excessively and there is no movement, operations are suspended. If it's pouring heavily and the boat is moving, it may have to dock at the nearest landing or jetty
Public.other_disruptions: Heavy rains disrupt the route, forcing boats in motion to dock at the nearest landing or jetty
Public.notes: The boat comes in the morning with passengers from Badore from 07:00am - 08:30 am and leaves with passengers from Liverpool (apapa) from 04:00pm - 05:00pm. In the evening, the boat goes from Liverpool to CMS/Marina to pick up passengers then to Five cowries Terminal to also pick up passengers before heading to the final destination.

Private.departure_trigger: They leave when they are full

Private.other_disruptions: Heavy rains disrupts the route, forcing boats in motion to dock at the nearest landing or jetty
Private.weekend: Same schedule
Private.notes: The banana boat can accommodate a maximum of fifteen passengers on this trip. Wait times are almost nonexistent on market days, which are tuesdays, fridays, and saturdays, as more people travel this route

Private.rain: If it drizzles, the boat will continue to move. If it is pouring excessively and there is no movement, operations are suspended. If it's pouring heavily and the boat is moving, it may have to dock at the nearest landing or jetty
Private.other_disruptions: Heavy rains disrupt the route, forcing boats in motion to dock at the nearest landing or jetty. Although, the distance is not that far
Private.weekend: Yes. Same schedule
Private.notes: Most of the time, passengers stand inside the boat. Compared to regular boats, the banana boats are substantially bigger. Because of the small distance, the operators believe that life jackets are unnecessary, hence they are not worn. After Five minutes, if there are no more passengers, the boats occasionally move
